name: Samurai Beach Bungalows - Port Stephens YHA

reviews.text: This has to be one of the best hostels I've stayed at for family-friendliness. It's located a few minute's drive from One Mile Beach, one of the best surf beaches at Port Stephens, and only a 15 minutes from Nelson Bay. If you have a vehicle, it's very central. If you don't have a vehicle, there are bikes offered for hire (very cheap).
reviews.title: A great family-friendly hostel

reviews.text: The kitchen & dining area is outside, there's a nice pool and the owners' dog is gorgeous (and friendly). The whole site is pretty, tucked away in the bush and it feels very private. All the accommodation (including dorm rooms) are spread out through a series of cabins.The family rooms are a decent size and better-than-average quality for a hostel. They even have a small TV! The one thing I would have liked was a private bathroom - there was one bathroom shared between 2 family rooms.
reviews.title: I can only recommend it.

reviews.text: It's not by any means the cheapest hostel we've stayed at but, considering its location, is really good value.
reviews.title: Beautiful and amazing

reviews.text: It's very relaxed and not at all a 'party' hostel. We had a great stay and will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: the most Idyllic hostel in Australia

reviews.text: At the beginning I only wanted to stay for two nights. After some very helpful information from Sandy (one of the owners) I found a job in Nelson Bay, just ten minutes away. I ended up staying at Samurai for more than a month and didn't regret one minute of that. The atmosphere was comforting and laid back which made it the perfect place to relax after a day of work. The people working there are really nice and help you anytime you need help, information or just a tip on where to spot a koala.
reviews.title: UK over 60's say ''What an Adventure,loved it,really loved it''

reviews.text: Staying at the bungalows was a great experience. I would recommend it to anybody, specially couples.
reviews.title: Great stay!
Now thats a Backpackers Hostel!!!
reviews.text: The staff is super nice, helpful and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Setup inside lush jungle...a nice place. A bit far away from places to be visited in Port stephens. Staff, the dog an python are friendly :)
reviews.title: Great ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are staying in YHA's across australia, this is by far our favorite spot. Mark and Sandy (the owners) were super friendly and made us feel right at home. The bungalows are really comfortable and surrounded by tropical paradise. With the beach a short walk away and all the Port Stephens has to offer a week long stay is still barely enough! We love Samurai Beach Bungalows.
reviews.title: Best hostel ever!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Samurai Beach Bungalows is quite difficult to get to if you do not have a car or sat nav. There is ample spaces for parking and all are close to the reception. We only stayed for one night and was happy to leave as we did not feel comfortable during our stay. When we met the receptionest she was very helpful and welcoming offering plenty of information regards to the local area.
reviews.title: Very quiet
Unusual concept. Best hostel on the East Coast
reviews.text: Once we arrived in our bungalow, we found it to have everything that we needed and all seemed well. Although everything was basic we could not help but notice the creepy crawlies on the bedroom roof above our bed. All it needed was a quick dust down though and everything was back to normal. In the room was refreshments, fridge, heater and linen which was maintained and well kept.

Our main fault with the bungalows (other than not experiencing any wildlife) was that the grounds are not very disabled person friendly. There are no ramps and the paths are very poorly lit (if even lit at all). The one to our bungalow was down a muddy hill which has been freshly watered making movement for my partner quite difficult.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

likes.disliked: — A little far from restaurants for people with out a car.

reviews.text: The Samurai YHA is set in beautiful lush grounds on the amazing Port Stephens penninsula. My sister and I stayed for 2 nights in June and went Whale watching and explored the sand dunes. The hostel is owned by a very friendly and welcoming couple, who did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. The cabins are cute and comfortable and the outdoor kitchen is great. Nice pool area and lots of character in the "Shed" (the TV room). The location is slightly remote, but there is a bus stop right in front of the property and the bus runs often enough and can get you all around the Port Stephens area.
reviews.title: Great place in a great jungle setting

reviews.text: Great place worth atleast a few nights stay!
reviews.title: Awesome hostel!

reviews.text: Great value for price. The owners (Mark and Sandy) are really nice people. They provide good facilities and services for free, such as booking trips for you, free sandboard borrowing, a pool table and a Wii for rainy days in a comfortable, unique shed. Really unique atmosphere, and the kitchen, despite being in the woods, had clean equipment like dishes, utensils, cutlery, cooking saucepans, stove, BBQ plate.
reviews.title: Nice Setting

reviews.text: Although I haven't been to any other hostels in Port Stephens, I really enjoyed the stay at the Bungalows!
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bungalows are nestled in a jungle like setting, which is super cool, and even the outdoor kitchen gets the odd visit from a kookaburra. Though not new, everything was cleaner than expected from a hostel in the jungle. Rooms were quite big and the beds comfy, kitchen well kept and stocked, fridge in rooms. The small pool was ok, not heated and with a bit of leaves and dirt in it. Hosts were extremely nice and made it a perfect place to unwind.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly and unique place. Excellent value!

aka: Samurai Beach Bungalows - Port Stephens YHA Anna Bay, Australia
description: Asian style bungalows set amongst 3 acres of rain forest gardens around a resort pool. Bush kitchen and campfire in winter.
